title: 115_s725
content: The Act titled "Transnational Criminal Organization Illicit Spotter Prevention and Elimination Act" enhances penalties for unlawfully hindering immigration, border, and customs controls. The Act prohibits illicit spotting and destruction of border controls, imposing fines and imprisonment for transmitting law enforcement information or damaging border security devices without authorization. The Act imposes fines and imprisonment for damaging border security devices without authorization, including barriers, sensor cameras, or other physical or electronic devices deployed by the Federal Government to control the border or a port of entry. Penalties include up to 10 years imprisonment for the offense, and up to 20 years if a firearm is used or possessed during the crime. Conspiracy or attempt to violate the Act results in similar punishment as completing the violation. The Act amends Section 924(c) of title 18, United States Code, to prohibit carrying or using a firearm during an alien smuggling crime.
